availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank D. Garrety (Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker and first lieutenant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker and soldier. Native of Ireland. Son of Edward Garrety and Catharine Garrety. Married to Alice O'Hearn Garrety. Father of Eddie Garrety, John M. Garrety, Mary A. Garrety, Cecelia Garrety, Kate Garrety, and Frank J. Garrety. Shoemaker in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Shoemaker in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Shoemaker in Louisville in 1861. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as first and second Lieutenant from December 14, 1861, to June 27, 1863. Wounded at the Battle of Perryville in Boyle County, Kentucky, on October 8, 1862.
